channel.title: Kramer Elementary School News
channel.description: News and announcements from Kramer Elementary School, including events, activities, and important dates.

item.title: Community Resources and Upcoming School Events
item.description:
Community Resources: PUSH (People United for Self Help) provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs. Contact Jeanne or Sabrina at 513-523-8100 or visit http://www.push-oxford.org/. Additional community events include Cincinnati Youth Choir (Vivo Coro Oxford for grades 3-6, Thursdays 6:00-7:00 PM at Miami University), English Language Café at Miami University (Tuesdays 6-7 PM starting September 16 in MacMillan Hall Room 017), and bus driver positions available through Petermann Transportation ($20/hr starting rate, $16/hr field trip rate, call 513-273-3150).

Upcoming School Events: Key dates include PTG meetings, grade-level music concerts, K-Kids meetings, winter break (12/22-1/6), spring break (3/30-4/6), Mother/Son Dance (1/31), Field Day (5/8), and last day of school (5/21).

PTG Meeting (Virtual)

item.title: PTG Meeting Rescheduled & Community Programs
item.description:
The November 18th PTG meeting has been rescheduled to Tuesday, December 2nd at 7 pm (virtual meeting). This allows members to attend the "Building a Tech Healthy Household" seminar on November 18th.

Additional programs: - Oxford Lions Club eyeglasses collection: Donate used eyeglasses and cases to Betsy Beaton (Marshall Elementary) or Shaunna Tafelski (Board Office) by early December - Read At Home (RAH): K-2nd grade program begins Wednesday, September 24th—students record books read at home for rewards - Kroger Rewards: Link your Kroger card to Kramer PTG at https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards to generate donations with purchases

Building a Tech Healthy Household Seminar

Kramer PTG Meeting (Rescheduled)

View original newsletter

item.title: Talawanda Food Pantry and Resources Available
item.description:
The Kramer Free Pantry is located at the entrance of Kramer and is stocked with free food and hygiene items for all students, including cereal, fruit, veggies, peanut butter, spaghetti, mac and cheese, soup, shampoo, and toothbrushes. To access pantry services, donate items, or learn about other Talawanda family resources, contact Chelsea Pike, Kramer Social Worker, at 513-273-3511 or pikec@talawanda.org. Donations can also be dropped off at the Kramer office.

View original newsletter

item.title: Thanksgiving Break and Return Date
item.description:
Kramer Elementary wishes families a Happy Thanksgiving and thanks students and families for their participation. Students return to school on Monday, December 1st after the Thanksgiving break.

This week's Kramer PAX Leaders recognized for good behavior: - KG: Otis Cherry, An'an Dong, Shep Kleibscheidel, Sophia Smith - 1st: Bryce Richardson, Vivienne Smiley, Dylan Wyatt - 2nd: Finley Peterson, Theo Siambekos - 3rd: Benjen Bufler, Ava Oppliger, Caleb Wiseman, Alicia Zheng - 4th: Nevaeh Hubbard, Gavin McCall, Aaliyah Pernell, Bentley Ramey - 5th: Gavin boling, Eden Chen, Elliot Ream, Sophia Webb

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Thanksgiving Turkey Art Display
item.description:
A large collaborative turkey artwork is displayed in the school, featuring a brown turkey body with googly eyes and yellow beak/feet, surrounded by colorful feathers that spread across the wall. Each feather appears to be individually decorated by students with various patterns, colors, and designs, creating a festive Thanksgiving display.

View original newsletter

item.title: Community Resources and Upcoming School Events
item.description:
This page highlights community resources and upcoming Kramer Elementary events. PUSH provides home repair grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District (513-523-8100, push-oxford.org). Additional opportunities include a shoe donation drive for 4Paws for Ability (collection until December 1st, any style/size accepted), Cincinnati Youth Choir Vivo Coro Oxford for grades 3-6 (Thursdays 6:00-7:00 PM at Miami University), English Language Café at Miami University (Tuesdays 6-7 PM starting September 16 in MacMillan Hall Room 017), and bus driver positions with Petermann Transportation (starting pay $20/hr, call 513-273-3150). The calendar includes numerous school events through May including K-Kids meetings, concerts, conferences, Field Day, and breaks for Thanksgiving, Winter, and Spring.

item.title: Holiday Adopt-A-Family Program for Kramer Students
item.description:
Support Kramer families this holiday season through the Adopt-A-Family program. Purchase items from the Amazon Wishlist and gifts will go directly to Kramer students or families needing extra support. For questions or if your family needs holiday assistance, contact Chelsea Pike at pikec@talawanda.org.

View original newsletter

item.title: PAX Classroom Leaders Highlighted This Week
item.description:
Kramer Elementary is beginning to highlight PAX classroom leaders weekly. This week's Kramer PAX Leaders include: - KG: Amelia Chen, Lorelai Dougherty, Hannah Neim, Josue Perez Gomes - 1st: Caroline Butler, Cora King, Hunter Stewart, Oscar Villanueva-Fuentes - 2nd: Charles Hricko, Lucy Ransdell, Avery Reece, Aiden Todd - 3rd: Kendall Gloyeske, Lucian Miller, Keyla Perez Gomez, Audrey Ream - 4th: Abby Bulanda, Luke Hricko, Liam Morrow, Levi Smith - 5th: Sonia Clark, Alyssa Martinez

One week remains until Thanksgiving break (November 24-28).

item.title: Weekly Update and Report Card Distribution
item.description:
Week ending November 6, 2025 at Kramer. Colder temperatures expected next week, so students should dress warmly. Report cards will be distributed on Friday, November 14th.

item.title: PTG Meeting Rescheduled and Community Updates
item.description:
The November 18th PTG meeting has been rescheduled to Tuesday, December 2nd at 7 PM (virtual meeting). This allows members to attend the "Building a Tech Healthy Household" seminar on November 18th at THS auditorium (6-7:30 PM). Additional updates include: Oxford Lions Club collecting used eyeglasses and cases for children in need (donate by early December to Betsy Beaton at Marshall Elementary or Shaunna Tafelski at Board Office), Kramer's Read At Home (RAH) program for K-2nd graders with first reward day September 24th, and a reminder to link your Kroger Rewards card to Kramer PTG at https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards.

item.title: Talawanda Food Pantry and Resources
item.description:
The Kramer Free Pantry is located at the entrance of Kramer and is stocked with free food and hygiene items for all students, including cereal, fruit, veggies, peanut butter, spaghetti, mac and cheese, soup, shampoo, and toothbrushes. Students can take any items they need for their families. For questions, donations, or to access additional Talawanda family resources, contact Chelsea Pike (Kramer Social Worker) at 513-273-3511 or pikec@talawanda.org, or drop donations at the Kramer office.

View original newsletter

item.title: Unplug and Play Event at Kramer Playground
item.description:
Unplug & Play Kramer is a flashlight fun event at dusk on Wednesday, November 5, 2025 from 5:30-7:00 PM at the Kramer playground. Kids receive a flashlight and engage in independent creative play while parents relax and chat with other parents and staff. Bring a lawn chair! Additional items include: a PTG meeting on Tuesday, December 2nd at 7PM (virtual), a LaRosa's Pizza fundraiser on Thursday, November 13 from 4PM-close (mention Kramer on receipt), and Reading At Home (RAH) program for K-2nd graders starting September 24th. Connect your Kroger Rewards card to Kramer PTG at https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards to support the school.

Unplug & Play Kramer - Flashlight Fun at Dusk

item.title: Halloween Celebration and Lost & Found Reminder
item.description:
Kramer Elementary celebrated Halloween this week with class parties and a parade. Thank you to all parents and volunteers who helped! Important reminders: - Check the lost and found - there's a large pile of items. View photos in the newsletter or visit the office. Unclaimed items will be donated after Thanksgiving break. - No school Tuesday, November 4th for Election Day.

item.title: Community Events and School Calendar
item.description:
The Community Page features local resources and upcoming school events. PUSH (People United for Self Help) provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs - call 513-523-8100 or visit http://www.push-oxford.org/. View the full community events page at the link above.

Key upcoming dates include: - No School: Nov 4 (Professional Development), Nov 24-28 (Thanksgiving Break), Dec 22-Jan 6 (Winter Break) - Music Concerts: Nov 12 (4th Grade), Dec 3 (5th Grade), Feb 25 (3rd Grade), Mar 10 (2nd Grade) - Special Events: Mother/Son Dance (Jan 31), Field Day (May 8), Last Day of School (May 21)

item.title: November 2025 Lunch Menu Available
item.description:
The Kramer Elementary November 2025 lunch menu features daily meal options with a choice of milk included. Notable items include: - Monday, November 3: Fish Sandwich or Popcorn Shrimp, Fish Nuggets, Homestyle Baked Beans, Celery Sticks with Ranch, Mixed Fruit - Tuesday, November 4: No School - Wednesday, November 5: Beef Pretzel Dog, Seasoned Green Beans, Fresh Cucumber Slices with Ranch, Fresh Grapes - Thursday, November 6: National Nacho Day - Tortilla Chips, Warm Cheese Cup & Salsa, Taco Fiesta Black Beans, Salsa or Marinara Cup, Pineapple Tidbits - Friday, November 7: 4x6 Rectangle Cheese Pizza, Honey Glazed Carrots, Fresh Romaine Garden Salad, Frozen Fruit Sidekick - Monday, November 18: Holiday Meal - Roast Turkey and Gravy, Garlic Knot Roll, Mashed Potatoes, Seasoned Green Beans, Pumpkin Applesauce - November 24-28: Thanksgiving Break - No School

Menu is subject to change based on product availability.

item.title: PTG Updates: Conference Meals, Reading Program, and Kroger Rewards
item.description:
Conference Meal Thanks: PTG thanks volunteers and donors, especially El Potrero, for supporting teacher and staff conference meals.

Read At Home (RAH) Program: Kindergarten through 2nd grade families can participate in the voluntary reading program starting Wednesday, September 24th (first reward day). Students record books read at home and turn in sheets weekly for alternating rewards: student-selected books or small prizes.

Kroger Community Rewards: Connect your Kroger Rewards card to Kramer PTG once, and Kroger will donate a percentage of your purchases to the PTG. Sign up at https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Health Guidelines from Nurse Briede
item.description:
Contact Information: Nurse Virginia Briede - briedev@talawanda.org, 513-273-3554

When to Keep Students Home: - Fever of 100°F or more: Student must stay home until fever-free for 24 hours minimum without medication (Tylenol or Motrin) - Vomiting/diarrhea: Student must be free of symptoms for 24 hours before returning to school

Head Lice Alert: A few cases have been detected in the building. Check your child's hair regularly, especially after sleepovers. Avoid sharing brushes. If treatment is needed, wash all bedding and dry on high heat. Contact the clinic for assistance purchasing lice treatment. [Link provided for article: "Staying Ahead of Head Lice"]

View original newsletter

item.description:
